title: Assistant Finance Manager
content:
About Ogilvy
Ogilvy was founded in 1948 by David Ogilvy. David created a culture that deeply respects and cares about its people and clients. Our mission is to inspire people and brands to make an impact and we are committed to attracting, growing, and retaining the best talent in the industry. 
About the Role  
To provide support to Reporting & Compliance Team through efficient control of finance processes and the timely delivery of effective reporting. To establish a collaborative relationship with the finance team, external auditors and internal auditors to ensure efficient reporting and compliance to statutory and SOX requirements.
What You’ll Do 

Preparation of consolidated financial reports and statutory accounts for all legal entities.
Preparation of statutory accounts for all Malaysia legal entities.
Establish internal and external timelines for audit and delivery of financial statements.
Manage statutory, corporate tax, withholding & GST requirements.
Liaise with auditors (internal & external) on all audit matters.
Liaise with corporate secretary on board resolutions and filing matters.
Implementation and maintenance of Sarbanes-Oxley control requirements.
Identifying and recommending enhancement to strengthen internal controls and operational efficiencies.
Any other ad-hoc tasks as assigned from time to time.

 
Qualities
 

Passion for compliance with a “can-do” attitude towards solving problems.
Good analytical and critical thinking skills.
Strong reasoning and organizational skills.
Able to perform under pressure and tight deadlines.
Attention to detail and ability to see the big picture.
Ability to work effectively and collaboratively with the finance team and cross-functional teams.

(The above statements describe the general nature and level of work being performed in this job.  They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all duties, and indeed additional responsibilities may be assigned, as required, by management.) 
 
Qualifications

Degree in Accountancy and/or ACCA/CPA/CA or equivalent.
Minimum 3-5 years of experience in financial reporting/accounting/audit.
Strong knowledge in financial reporting, SOX and internal controls
High level of proficiency in Microsoft Excel.
Familiar with MS Office applications.

How We’ll Support You 
Ogilvy celebrates its people. Fully. Enthusiastically. Unhesitatingly. We’ll empower you with the tools you’ll need to succeed. We’ll give you the autonomy to seek out new paths and better ways of doing things. We’ll support you with colleagues who are experts in their disciplines, drawn from across the Ogilvy network. And we’ll provide opportunities for you to do work of which you’ll be proud, with people you’ll be proud to call your teammates.  


At Ogilvy, our people are at the heart of what we do: a creative agency that sparks game-changing ideas across culture and business through collaboration, integrity, and a celebration of self-expression. 
We believe in building powerful teams with purpose. This means hiring and nurturing talent across all races, ethnicities, religions, abilities, sexual orientation, and gender identities – and we relentlessly curate transformative initiatives that make our commitment to fairness, and equity a reality. 
Our ultimate mission is to leave a positive impact on the world, creating a better future for all, while supporting and uplifting the global communities we serve.  This is central to our mantra of Borderless Creativity.
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.
